name: Azuki
headline: Japanese comic subscription service
description: Azuki: Your Digital Manga Cafe is Netflix-style Japanese comic subscription service where users can subscribe for $4.99 a month to unlock access to all the manga on the service. Free users have access to select chapters with ads.

founders.name: Abbas Jaffery, Founder
founders.description: I've worked across a variety of fields in my career including community management, quality assurance, backend engineering, product management, and now CEO of KiraKira Media. So I'm a bit of a jack of all trades which allows me to have a good understanding of how different types of systems work with each other and how to work in non-dev roles. In my personal life I'm a cat person with 2 of my own, a fan of anime/manga/film/games, non-alcoholic by choice, and like to go to comedy shows.

founders.name: Adela Chang, Founder
founders.description: Co-founder at KiraKira Media Inc., musician, and published webtoon writer. Prior to Azuki, I worked as senior mobile developer at companies such as Crunchyroll, Yelp, Medium, and Facebook. Graduated in 2014 from U.C. Berkeley with a B.A. in Computer Science and minor in East Asian Languages and Cultures (specifically Japanese and Korean).

founders.name: Evan Minto, Founder
founders.description: Designer, web developer, accessibility nerd, manga expert, and anime hamburger aficionado. Heading up design, marketing, and content acquisition for Azuki. In my spare time I drive myself insane watching cartoons and podcast about it.

founders.name: Krystyn Neisess, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder and passionate Android developer for KiraKira Media Inc.

I'm primarily responsible for anything and everything Android dev and social media; I also assist with design and marketing efforts.  I'm very bubbly and excitable, but don't let that fool you!  Beneath that is a highly ambitious and industrious spirit.

founders.name: Ken Urata, Founder
founders.description:
Co-founder of KiraKira Media, Inc., working on Azuki: Your Digital Manga Cafe.

My prior work experience include Software Engineer at Crunchyroll and Thumbtack, and English to Japanese translator (native level in both languages). On the side, I operate a bilingual manga analytics website.

generated_description:
### Overview of Azuki

**Name:** Azuki  
**Founded:** 2020  
**Location:** San Francisco, California  
**Team Size:** 5 Employees  
**Y Combinator Batch:** W22  
**Website:** [azuki.co](https://www.azuki.co)

---

### Mission

Azuki is a subscription-based service modeled as a digital manga cafe, inspired by the likes of Netflix. Their aim? To provide easy access to an extensive library of Japanese comics, making the world of manga more accessible for fans everywhere.

### Subscription Details

- **Price:** $4.99 per month
- **Free Tier:** Limited access to select chapters with ads
- **Benefits of Subscription:** Unlimited access to thousands of manga chapters

### Offerings

Azuki offers an impressive variety of manga across genres, making it a go-to platform for manga enthusiasts. Whether you’re into action, comedy, romance, or more niche genres, you'll find something to enjoy. Some popular titles include:

- **"I Want to Escape from Princess Lessons"** - Follow Leticia as she runs from her royal fiancé.
- **"Tokyo Interstellar Immigration"** - Experience cosmic crimes and intense cop dynamics.
- **"Gourmet Glutton"** - Chronicles a salaryman diving into the competitive eating world.

### Current Features

- **Read Free Sections:** Users can sample certain chapters at no cost.
- **Premium Trials:** New users can try full access for free for 14 days.
- **Gift Memberships:** Users can share the manga love with friends and family.

### Notable Partnerships

- **Group Partner:** Nan

### Key Tags

- **Tagged Under:** Entertainment, Subscriptions, San Francisco Bay Area

### Why It Matters

Azuki is tapping into the booming popularity of manga by leveraging a subscription model that invites new and seasoned readers alike into the vibrant world of Japanese comics. It’s a smart move in a space that’s continually warming up to American audiences.

Whether you are a long-time manga lover or just starting your journey, Azuki makes it easy to dive into this colorful and eclectic art form with its diverse selection and affordable pricing. Take a glimpse into the world of manga with a premium membership today!
